TrainingDetails.Title: Document, Media, and Image Elements
TrainingDetails.BodyCopy:
The Document element allows users to link to a document on the web server.  The Browse button opens the \Documents directory in the Manage Asset dialog.  Selecting a file in this dialog populates the field with the name of the file. 

 The Browse button launches the Manage Asset dialog to select a document for upload.

Media Element

The Media element allows users to link to a media file on the web server. The Browse button opens the \Media directory in the Manage Asset dialog.  Selecting a file in this dialog populates the field with the name of the file. 

 The Browse button launches the Manage Asset dialog for selecting a media file.

 The Collapse button shows a sub-set of media attributes.
 The Expand button shows all available media attributes.

  

Image Element

The Image element allows a user to select an image from the \Images directory to display on the current page.  The user selects an image from the Manage Asset dialog which then populates the field with the name of the image.  The element provides a number of options for formatting the image.

 The Browse button launches the Manage Asset dialog for selecting an image file.

 The Collapse button shows a sub-set of image attributes.
 The Expand button shows all available image attributes.

Once the image is selected, the full Image Edit suite of tools is available:

Component Creation

Alt Text - text to appear when mousing over the image on a rendered page.

Keywords - tags for this image.

Spacing

Hspace - sets the horizontal spacing (in pixels) around the image determining how close text wraps around the image on the rendered page.
Vspace - sets the horizontal spacing (in pixels) around the image determining how close text wraps around the image on the rendered page.

Layout

Alignment - position of the image file on the rendered page. 

Border - specifies a pixel border to help the image stand out from the background.

Thumbnail - a display of the image in reduced size.
